channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Climate change is boosting the risk of sleep apnea
item.description: Hotter temperatures make breathing problems during sleep more likely, even when it's not extremely hot

item.title: An AI video ad is making a splash. Is it the future of advertising?
item.description: The over-the-top ad combines the energy of Grand Theft Auto with the drama of the NBA Finals — all created by AI. Is it a sign of things to come?

item.title: 'It's such a dream': Top high school performers step out on Broadway
item.description: With a billboard in Times Square and a night on Broadway, the year's top high school performers are ready for their big moment at the Jimmy Awards.

item.title: The David Lynch estate auction doubled as a caffeinated wake
item.description: Most of the bidding action was online. But at a ritzy Beverly Hills hotel, hopeful bidders united by genuine affection for Lynch admired the tools of ...

item.title: From the fringes to the mainstream: Meet the hardline anti-immigration activist who helped shape Trump's agenda
item.description: The former leader of FAIR, the Federation for American Immigration Reform, Dan Stein, retired this year after more than 40 at the helm of the organiza...

item.title: Terrorism advisory bulletin warns of "heightened threat environment" in U.S.
item.description: A bulletin from the National Terrorism Advisory System warns of a "heightened threat environment" in the U.S. following the military strikes on Iran's...

item.title: 1 injured, suspect dead after shooting at church in Wayne
item.description: Police in Wayne, Michigan, say one person is injured and a suspect is dead after a shooting at a church Sunday morning.

item.title: Workers find 1,000-year-old mummy while installing pipes
item.description: The mummy had gone unnoticed despite urban development in a district where agricultural fields have been converted into working-class neighborhoods.

item.title: Race to find survivors after Russian attack hits apartments in Kyiv
item.description: A Russian missile and drone attack on Ukraine's capital killed at least 5 people, with more feared missing under the rubble of a damaged Kyiv apartmen...

item.title: Strait of Hormuz: What happens if Iran shuts global oil corridor?
item.description: Iran's threat to block the world's most vital oil transit point has raised fears of major global economic consequences.

item.title: The number of abortions kept rising in 2024 because of telehealth prescriptions, report finds
item.description: A new report finds that the number of abortions in the U.S. grew in 2024 as more women obtained pills through telehealth.

item.title: Israel, Iran trade fire again as Trump hints at Iranian regime change
item.description: Trump says U.S. strikes "totally obliterated" 3 Iranian nuclear facilities, but the extent of the damage to Iran's nuclear program remains unclear.

item.title: US asks China to stop Iran from closing Strait of Hormuz
item.description: Iran's Press TV had earlier reported that parliament had approved a plan to close the Strait.

item.title: ICE detains Marine Corps veteran’s wife who was still breastfeeding their baby
Seven killed in Kyiv in new Russian aerial attack
item.description: Russian missiles and drones hit residential areas and hospitals in Ukraine's Kyiv region, the interior minister says.

item.title: Dozens of soldiers seized in Colombian mountains
item.description: The military says the civilians were acting under pressure from dissidents of the Farc rebel group.

item.title: First celestial image unveiled from revolutionary telescope
item.description: The telescope should detect killer asteroids and may even find the ninth planet in our solar system.

item.title: Eastern half of US sweltering again, with dangerous heat wave expected to last until midweek
